body: Should fix issues identified following merge of https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/pull/2910

comment_data.body: I think you don't need this check at all since we can trust there's a fname coming in.

maybe this works?

`local root_dir = util.root_pattern 'mix.exs'(maybe_umbrella_path) or util.root_pattern 'mix.exs'(child_or_root_path)`

a bit redundant, but this way we're not using dirname and instead rely on the utils from lspconfig.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -4,7 +4,15 @@ return {
   default_config = {
     filetypes = { 'elixir', 'eelixir', 'heex', 'surface' },
     root_dir = function(fname)
-      return util.root_pattern 'mix.exs'(fname) or util.find_git_ancestor(fname) or vim.loop.os_homedir()
+      if not fname or fname == "" then
+        fname = vim.fn.getcwd()
+      end
+
+      local matches = vim.fs.find({ "mix.exs" }, { upward = true, limit = 2, path = fname })
+      local child_or_root_path, maybe_umbrella_path = unpack(matches)
+      local root_dir = vim.fs.dirname(maybe_umbrella_path or child_or_root_path)

comment_data.body: My main issue is that I don't understand what the constraints are here. Why can't we use `dirname`? Does this mean we can't use `vim.fs.find` either? Can @glepnir offer any guidance?

comment_data.body:
wonder this not work ?

```lua
  local result = vim.fs.find ('mix.exs', {upward = true, limit = math.huge, path = fname})
  return #result > 0 and result[#reuslt] or uv.cwd()
```

comment_data.body: But we need to return a directory path, right? Hence the use of `dirname`. Again, for me the question is really what functions we can and can't use, and why? What is different about this "single file mode"?

comment_data.body: So what's with the CI complaining about `dirname`? The CONTRIBUTING document says: "Do not add vim.fn.cwd or util.path.dirname in root_dir.", but doesn't offer a reason _why_, so I don't really have a way of knowing what exactly I need to avoid, or what other function or behaviour could be problematic.

comment_data.body:
I'm sorry, where should I be setting this? A search in `nvim-lspconfig` reveals zero instances of `single_file_mode`, so I'm all out of clues.

BTW, the code in this PR works just fine for me. As far as I'm concerned, and unless I can understand the constraints better, the problem seems to be the CI...?

comment_data.body:
Your [suggestion below](https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/pull/2911#discussion_r1422266681) led me to find `lspconfig-single-file-support` in the `lspconfig` help. IIUC, the idea here is that if `root_dir` returns `nil`, and `single_file_support` is on, then this mode will be used?

I don't really get how this helps with the issue of `dirname` being rejected by the CI, though :confused:

comment_regular_data.body: OK, the CI informs me I've broken some rules. I can see in [CONTRIBUTING](https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#adding-a-server-to-lspconfig.) that I shouldn't be using these functions. Is this something to do with "single file mode" passing different input to this function, so it needs to be handled differently?
@glepnir Did you have a chance to review this? We'd appreciate your guidance here.

title: fix(elixirls): smarter detection of root_dir for umbrella apps
